name: cfoutput
description: Displays output that can contain the results of processing CFML variables and functions. You can use the `query` attribute to loop over the result set of a database query.

params.name: query
params.description: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for output section.

params.name: group
params.description:
Query column to use to group sets of records. Eliminates
 adjacent duplicate rows when data is sorted. Use if you
 retrieved a record set ordered on one or more a query
 columns. For example, if a record set is ordered on
 "Customer_ID" in the cfquery tag, you can group the output
 on "Customer_ID."

params.name: groupcasesensitive
params.description: Whether to consider the case in grouping rows.

params.name: startrow
params.description:
Row from which to start output. Only considered when the query attribute is set.
This attribute in combination with maxrows can be used to create some paging.

params.name: maxrows
params.description: Maximum number of rows to display. Only considered when the query attribute is set.

params.name: encodefor
params.description: CF2016+ Lucee5.1+ When set applies an encoder to all variables to prevent XSS. For example if you specify `html` each variable will be wrapped by a call to the `encodeForHTML` function.

examples.title: Loop over a query
examples.description: Loops over each row of the query specified and outputs the result.

examples.title: Loop over a range of rows of a query
examples.description: Loops over 10 rows of the query specified starting from row 5 and outputs the result.

examples.title: Using the encodeFor attribute
examples.description: CF2016+ Lucee5.1+ By specifying `encodefor="html"` each varaible is encoded using the `encodeForHTML` function before it is output.

examples.title: Using the group attribute
examples.description: Creates a dummy query `food`, with columns `name` and `type`. Then outputs the food by grouping by the type.
